text.value: I'd like to add a new module to my project to act as a eureka server rather with an older version of Spring boot starter, but if I create a new Spring Boot application from the start.spring.io it won't give me a choice to use an older version. How to solve this?

Here are a few options to create a new Spring Boot module with an older version in an existing project:
1. Manually create the module and configure the Spring Boot dependencies in the pom.xml with the desired version. For example:
```xml <dependency> <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId> <artifactId>spring-boot-starter</artifactId> <version>1.5.10.RELEASE</version> </dependency> ```
2. Use the Spring Initializr to generate a new project with the old version, then copy over the pom.xml and src code into your project structure.
3. Use the Spring Boot Maven plugin to generate the module. You can specify the Spring Boot version like:
```xml <plugin> <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId> <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.5.10.RELEASE</version> <executions> <execution> <goals> <goal>repackage</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> </plugin> ```
4. Clone an older version of spring-boot-sample-project from GitHub and copy over the module contents.
So in summary, you have a few options to manually create or generate the module with specific versions rather than using start.spring.io.
